# Number of lines of code in ans_eval: 6
sub ans_eval {
    my $self = shift;
    my $ans_eval = shift;
    $self->{ans_eval}= $ans_eval if ref($ans_eval);
    $self->{ans_eval};
}

# Number of lines of code in append_responses: 5
sub append_responses { #add or modify a response to the PGresponsegroup object
    my $self = shift;
    my @response_list = @_;  # ordered list of label/ value pairs
    $self->{response}->append_responses(@response_list);        
}

public method PGanswergroup::delete_from_hash (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in delete_from_hash: 14
sub delete_from_hash {   # don't want to redefine delete
    my $self = shift;
    my @in = @_;
    my %hash = ();
    if ( ref($in[0]=~/HASH/) ) {
        %hash = %{$in[0]};
    } else {
        %hash = @in;
    }
    foreach my $key (keys %hash) {
        $self->{$key} = undef;
    }
    $self;  
}

public method PGanswergroup::insert (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in insert: 15
sub insert {         # add new values to PGanswergroup keys preserve existing values
    my $self = shift;
    my @in = @_;
    my %hash = ();
    if ( ref($in[0]=~/HASH/) ) {
        %hash = %{$in[0]};
    } else {
        %hash = @in;
    }
    foreach my $key (keys %hash) {
        next if not_null( $self->{$key} );
        $self->{$key} = $hash{$key};
    }
    $self;  
}

sub insert_response_value { # add a response value(with  label defined by answer group label)
    my $self = shift;
    my $value = shift;
    $self->{response}->append_reponse($self->{ans_label}, $value);
}
public method PGanswergroup::insert_responses (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in insert_responses: 6
sub insert_responses    {        # add a group of responses ( label/value pairs)
    my $self = shift;
    my @response_list = @_;
    $self->{response}->clear();
    $self->{response}->append_responses(@response_list);
}
public method PGanswergroup::new (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in new: 16
sub new {
    my $class = shift;  
    my $label = shift;
    my $self = {
        ans_label => $label,
        ans_eval  => undef,                         # usually an AnswerEvaluator, sometimes a CODE
        response  => new PGresponsegroup($label),    # A PGresponse object which holds the responses 
                                                    # which make up the answer
        active    => 1,                             # whether this answer group is currently active (for multistate problems)

        @_,
    };
    bless $self, $class;    
    return $self;

}
public method PGanswergroup::replace (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in replace: 14
sub replace {     # add new values ot PGanswergroup, overwriting existing values when duplicated
    my $self = shift;
    my @in = @_;
    my %hash = ();
    if ( ref($in[0]=~/HASH/) ) {
        %hash = %{$in[0]};
    } else {
        %hash = @in;
    }
    foreach my $key (keys %hash) {
        $self->{$key} = $hash{$key};
    }
    $self;  
}
public method PGanswergroup::replace_response (  )

# Number of lines of code in replace_response: 6
sub replace_response { # add a response value(with  label defined by answer group label)
    my $self = shift;
    my $response_label = shift;
    my $value = shift;
    $self->{response}->replace_response($response_label, $value);
}
